caption: Very good food and the crew are very polite, filipino hospitality at its best.

If you order to go here, the staff doesn't check if your order is complete when you pick it up. This happened to me twice. It is not my job to check if my order is complete. The staff/ownership there thinks that just because they are the only Max's chicken in Chicago, they can get away with providing bad customer service.

First off Max’s restaurant is usually good from other states that I’ve been to and ate there. My first time taking food out and eating from this location as I am only visiting family in town and wanted to try this location. My family and I ordered food for take out cause of covid and all we understand the protocols of taking food out. Usually I don’t like writing reviews when it’s bad but my experience and my family’s experience with the food we ordered was not appetizing at all after opening the food and serving it on a platter. Food looked old and unsafe to eat in the way that the food was cooked/prepared. The pork BBQ was bunched up on the stick so the meat was not cooked properly. The lechon kawali..well let’s just say it was like scraps put in a box for to go. The sisig was very watery for some reason and tasted odd. The kare kare was probably the only thing that tasted decent. Overall please don’t serve the food to customers if it is not ready to be serve. I rated two stars because the employee that took our order on the phone was very pleasant to talk to. Customer service on the phone was great but the food did not serve anything other than unacceptable to eat. Sorry Max Chicago. I hope to have a better experience for my family and I. I would ask for a refund if possible only because the food was not up to par to the company’s standard or even as a customer as myself who experienced this.
Our go to place for Filipino dishes! 🥰
Crispy Pata & Chicken is so good!
Thank you Apple for taking care of us! Can't go wrong with Filipino food for a Friday date night.
Very slow
They offer a vast variety of fresh food. I liked dining here. Employees are always very friendly, rates are affordable and the place is always kept clean.

I absolutely love this restaurant. I heard so many things about them and decided to try it. We order few stuff which are fried chicken pork and noodles. OMG everything is sooooo delicious. Pork is so moist it's melting in your mouth,chicken is well cooked and noodles are EVERYTHING!!!! I am now ordering weekly here and will continue. I think I never try better egg rolls in Chicago. Customer Service is great everyone are so nice and friendly,and super super clean restaurant. Will come back.
Service was extraordinarily slow, inaccurate and not friendly. Had to ask for our bill multiple times and had to go to the counter multiple times to get it.
Price, food and service to the T!

(Translated by Google) Best fried chicken 🐔 in town ... Pinakbet is my favorite, and da-ing na bangus. Bulalo and stewed beef is perfect for all time.  (Original) Best fried chicken 🐔 in town... Pinakbet is my favorite, and da-ing na bangus. Bulalo and nilagang baka is perfect for all time.
Superb vibes and very personal service. The meals were fresh and yummy. Will easily recommend this restaurant to others. Convenient rates and large portions. Good job.
This place provides extraordinary service as well as delicious meals. My favourite spot ever. The meals came out quick and the rates are inexpensive. Recommended.
Best fried chicken and tasty pancit bihon.
Service is terrible! We end up leaving after waiting for 30 minutes when no one came and ask for our order!

Before Max came to Chicago, my family and I would seek out the Max’s restaurants in the Philippines and here in the states with the few that were around.  This is the first in the Midwest and we couldn’t be more excited!  We love the hospitality and the food.  The fried chicken is what they are known for and they have many other popular authentic Filipino dishes.  When you eat the crispy fried chicken, it’s recommended to dip the chicken in banana ketchup mixed with a couple drops of Worcestershire sauce!  The chicken goes well with their garlic rice.  My other favorite is the Lechon Kawali sisig!  You can ask the server for an egg to be added to the sizzle if you want to be a little more adventurous lol!  I also recommend the pansit bihon!  For dessert, I’m happy that the Turon was added which is served warm with vanilla ice cream & chocolate drizzle!  My husband and I recently enjoyed the langsilog & bangsilog breakfast items.  The staff are friendly and warm!  I recommend Max’s!
Best food, very nice employees, regularly fantastic mood. They charge fair pricing and the food quality is good. I recommend this place.
Good food but servers are not professional so if you gonna eat just go for take out

THE BEST CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!  I live in Canada and I ordered for my uncle in Chicago.  They were so accommodating and helpful. I know that they have a busy day today, and still, they made an effort to help me.  Shoutout to Manager Dennis Yu, and the very nice lady who took my order. They were so patient with me.  So very helpful. They went out of their way to see this order through.  On behalf of my entire family, thank you, Max’s Fried Chicken Chicago for making this a truly special day for my uncle and his family. Maraming maraming salamat po sa lahat ng bumubuo ng Max’s Fried Chicken Chicago!

I’ll give the hostess  two stars for being attentive and professional. Unfortunately she has to call the waiter to help us after we were sitting for 15 mins for service. The waiter did not introduce himself nor served us water. We have to ask for it. Also I think the food is not as good and authentic as other Filipino restaurants within the area. I don’t recommend this place.

I loved their chicken, pansit, pork belly, sinigang soup, and beef peanut stew. There were so many more dishes there that I never heard of despite growing up pretty familiar with Filipino food, and I want to try all of them. You can't find any of these authentic dishes anywhere else. The place is really clean and service was great. It was really easy when we went back for pick-up during quarantine, too. Can't wait to go back again to try the more unique dishes!
Authentic pinoy!

This site is my favorite place.  Of all restaurants I know I prefere it most. I never miss an opportunity to go to that place. Whenever  I want to go to a good lunch, this place comes straightaway to my mind.  Great and diverse  food and a large list of dishes.helpful staff members, and nice spirit. In addition to that, the tariff is decent. I praise this restaurant with no doubt.

Fried chicken did not taste like chicken, too bland. Palabok noodle was hard. Sisig was sweet. Should sisig be sweet? The only dish I like was pancit canton. Sorry can’t recommend this place. To my dissatisfaction, I went to Jollibee next door to get fried chicken;  it was  a lot better than Max.

Ordered a full chicken deep-fried to go and an appetizer order of lumpia. Opened it up immediately when I get home and I must say this is one of the best Lumpia's and crispy fried chickens I've had in Chicago. Great job you guys I will definitely be back.
I visit this place a lot since I work nearby. I love how the service is always excellent and they keep the spot well organized consistently. Prices are convenient and they serve generous portions.
IMG_1241.JPG.jpeg
Food was amazing. Very friendly and service was good as well. Would definitely come back here again:)
The chicken isn’t up to par with what I’ve experienced in LA or LV- the halo halo too  I really like Max’s Restaurant as a brand I hope they can improve upon this!
The food and service were ahead of our expectations. We absolutely liked the vibes of this spot. Fantastic place to take the family out for dinner.

I adore this place! They offer high class meals, their menu is large, The chef in that restaurant is well trained, I like very much tasting all their dishes. The food is consistently of high class, the attitude towards the visitors  is helpful. I often eat in this place and I was never discontended. I recommend it with no hesitation.
Finest food, friendly employees, constantly fantastic character. They charge convenient pricing and the food quality is great. Fantastic work.

We decided to eat here for lunch. Fortunately the wait was just a few minutes for three. The restaurant specialization is in Pinoy cuisine. Overall the restaurant is clean and has enough space for customers to be comfortable. The menu contains many familiar food items and we selected the whole fried chicken, Kare-Kare, Pinakbet and some Bulalo.  The fried chicken was very moist and just a bit salty, the Kare-Kare was great, the Pinakbet was also a bit salty most likely due to the shrimp paste, and the Bulalo was nearly perfect. We will definitely return again as the tastes reminded us of an authentic Pinoy meal at a somewhat reasonable cost.

I'm sitting here halfway through a supposed 1 hour wait for seating. There are only a few people waiting and 2 clean and empty booths. They have turned away at least 20 people because they keep telling them its 1 hour to be seated. Why?  We walked out. It is unconscionable for there to be empty tables while people are waiting. There is no excuse for such poor service.

Waiting time after the order was taken: more than 30 minutes!  Prices: expensive, portion: small. The famous fried chicken: very dry, as if reheated in the microwave. Chicken inasal, yuck! Sisig: just warm, not sizzling, tasted bad. The waiter replaced it with another entree of the same price.To their credit masarap ang kare kare, very small portion! This is a one-time-visit restaurant, although I visited 2times because a friend wanted to try it, the same bad experience. I asked the server why it’s taking so long to bring the food out, answer “marami po kasing tao!”, huh!
Glad to have a new place for Filipino food in Chicago. Keep up the good food quality and care for the customers.
Good food. They have the best chicken and crispy pata!

This place is the one I always prefer. I eat in a lot of restaurants but to this place I keep coming back again and again. The team is very welcoming and the cooking they cook is so delicious. I am always happy to have a good meal in this place. I recommend this place with pleasure.

Decided to check out this new Chicago Filipino restaurant to see what the hype is all about. So we ordered the crispy fried chicken that they are famous for. It's alright, but definitely does not measure up with their Los Angeles and Las Vegas restaurants. The chicken was crispy but the meat was a little dry. Their "sago at gulaman" didn't look like it had the traditional molasses you would expect, but it was extremely sweet, I had to add a total of  two glasses of water as I was consuming it, to normalize the candied drink. Price was decent and place was super clean. Still, the place was packed with a lot of people waiting.

The restaurant is super clean and the Kare Kare is absolutely a dream! I love the chicken and plan on returning again and again!  Gino Viola has brought Filipino food to the fore front and it’s delicious

Best food so far.... Mon thru Thursday not too busy fast serving. Server are great. Some filipino have no patience and didnt understand that this restaurant is a sit down restaurant meaning eat first before you pay and full service. Definitely not fast food, which  even drinks you have to get your own and pay first before you eat. Mga Filipino talaga crab mentality.
Recently stopped by Max's restaurant while visiting my Brother. This was the first time trying flipino food and I must say the food was good.

Fried Chicken was the best i had since moving to Chicago. The staff, made me feel at home and didn't have to wait long at all for my meal. I would recommend this restaurant to all my Friends, Family and i will continue to be a regular customer
Amazing food! Great taste. Definitely a must stop place if you’re visiting or live in Chicago. Chicken is great!

Too expensive and food is not good. Ordered pancit canton, seems like we ordered sauteed carrots dahil mas marami pa yung carrots kesa sa canton! The service is bad too, nobody checked on us and had to go to the reception to ask for our bill. Not too many food selection. Definitely not going back

The chicken was extremely dry! It tasted like it was reheated after we placed the order. It didn’t take long for our chicken to arrive after placing the order with the waiter. Shouldn’t it take longer than 5mins to fry, especially since it was a whole chicken? Never coming here again.

Came in a little before 5pm on the weekday(two hours before closing) and ordered the whole chicken with fries. Unfortunately, the chicken was dry, as if it was reheated in the microwave(like what the other reviewer said) shortly after placing the order. If I were you, go eat the fried chicken at Jollibee right next door, instead.

Not worth the time and money! It took us 30min to get seated and another 35min to be served. The wait was so long, only to be even more disappointed by their low quality cooking. The traditional Max’s flavor was indistinguishable, as the sisig was soggy and had an aftertaste. Their iconic chicken was dry. The pancit didn’t even have complete ingredients, even for something as simple as carrots. Truly a sad attempt for a taste of the Philippines.
